alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Lauderdale; Newton (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 4:48AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Newton, southeastern Kemper and Lauderdale Counties through 530 AM CDT... At 447 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Electric Mills to near Marion to near Newton. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lauderdale, Meridian Station, Marion and Porterville around 455 AM CDT. Toomsuba around 500 AM CDT. Kewanee, Alamucha and Meehan around 505 AM CDT. Savoy around 510 AM CDT. Increase around 525 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Chunky and Hickory. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for east central Mississippi.
